Robbie Amell, I feel would fit the character of Ethan. He portrays characters that have a busy life style and plays characters well in settings where there is a lot of conflict but can make it humourist and deal with it well. Http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2064412/?ref_=nmbio_trv_2
Gina Rodriguez, I feel would play Kartina well. She is able to handle roles where the character is a bit crazy because of things that are occurring in the characters life. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1752221/?ref_=tt_cl_t1
Michael Grant Terry I feel would play cancer cowboy. Because he has a southern like personality in the television shows I have seen while also playing a tech savvy and creative character. When first reading Cancer Cowboys character I immediately pictured this actor. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2163204/?ref_=ttfc_fc_cl_t9
Robbie Amell would get top billing because he is the main character and then Gina Rodriguez and lastly Michael Grant Terry. I feel these actors would correspond well with each other and make the show serious but add the physical written humour that is present in the text.

1. Katherine Heigl as Kaitlin Joyce. Katherine is a tall, strong, blonde female actress, and was almost too pretty when I decided to pick her for Ethan’s character. I chose her anyways because her character portrayals embody somebody eager to learn and prove themselves, and someone who won’t stop until she achieves her dreams.
2. Zach Braff as Ethan Jarlewski. With Zach Braff’s charm and boyish good looks, I think he makes the perfect candidate for our less-than-perfect jPodder. Based on the Ethan Jarlewski from the TV series jPod, Zach Braff and him share similar characteristics; are tall, brunette, lanky, and slightly awkward. Zach Braff’s love life as portrayed by characters he’s played has never been smooth sailing, and it often takes a lot of courage for him to work up the guts and make the first move.
3. Jason Biggs as Steve Lefkowitz. I chose this pairing because although the character normally portrayed by Jason Biggs means good, and is an overall good person, the viewer just loves to hate him (or at least I do). Biggs’ short-lived stint on the new Netflix series “Orange is the New Black” proves that the character he played was so undesirable it got removed from the show at the end of the second season. He will ultimately be getting paid the least since after the American Pie movies his career never quite took off. He’s a generic flat character that generally does not have much to offer for other.

Ethan J- Robert Downy Jr. Ethan is seen as the "main guy" in the show since the camera is almost always pointed at him. I see Ethan as a critical thinker and intelligent. Robert Downy often plays a similar role and has a personality that is serious, critical thinker, and often portrayed as a heroic figure. The moment I figured out who Ethan was in the show, Robert Downy was the very first actor that got me reminded of him because he has an intelligent look and knowledgeable in computers.
Steve- Bryan Cranston- Bryan Cranston Steve is overly optimistic and self-absorbed. In the show, he acts as the commander in chief, but in a funny way. There is a conflicting character roles in my mind when I think of Bryan Cranston as he does both acting in comedy-type movies and serious-type movies. I've seen Bryan Cranston in military roles and I can never take him seriously, just like Steve. So putting Robert Downy and Bryan Cranston together could be an interesting mix because basing on the character types of these two actors, they would just annoy each other, which works well since Ethan doesn't really like Steve.
Cancer Cowboy- Rowan Atkinson Cancer boy is always goofing around in the movie doing sillly things like in Episode 1 when he is half naked. Cancer boy is the comedian in the J-pod floor and that's why I've chosen Rowan Atkinson. It's such an interesting concept to think. Rowan in Mr. Bean does a lot of funny stupid things, just like the role of Cancer Cowboy.

Ethan: Patrick J Adams
I chose Patrick as an appropriate actor to play Ethan because Patrick is well known for his performance as a star on the TV series Suits. Patrick plays the intelligent and witty character extremely well and would be a perfect fit for the similar character Ethan in J-pod. Similar to Ethan, Patrick's most famous performances includes a flirty relationship with a co-worker and charming personality. As a result of Patrick's experience in a similar character role, he would be the best fit for Ethan's character.
Carol: Elizabeth Mitchel
Although I feel as if the mother on the TV series J-pod was casted quite well, I could also see Elizabeth Mitchel taking on this role and making a better performance. Elizabeth Mitchel plays a variety of different characters in films, however, I find that she performs best in a motherly role. The mother in J-pod is not going to win mother of the year, but I could definitely see Elizabeth Mitchel taking on the role and enhancing the attractive and sneaky side to Carol's character.
Jim: Alec Baldwin
Alec Baldwin is well known for his lazy, sloppy character roles. I have not seen many movies where his character has his act together. His characters are usually chasing after women, much like Ethan's fathers in J-pod. Jim was found early on in the TV series cheating with one of Ethan's former classmates. Alec Baldwin enhance the deceitful and woman focused characteristics of Ethan's father.

I love your casting Ken Jeong for the mobster! that would be hilarious, and he's so good at those types of people. Also kudos on thinking of Jamie Lee Curtis! I was thinking of Angelica Houston, but Jamie might be better at portraying a regular housewife with the streak of badass.

Carol Jarlewski - Angelica Houston. A mix between the Adams Family and Life Aquatic. She's someone I could see being a somewhat awkward mother, but totally badass when she has to be. (I also like the idea of Jamie Lee Curtis that someone else mentioned for Carol)
Mr. Jarlewski - Jason Alexander. He's really good at the awkward characters. I can definitely see a marriage between him and Angelica being nice at the beginning but eventually they become bored with eachother and start pursuing other romances, and even though Jason is a funny guy, I could see him as an unsuccessful wanna-be actor with a younger lover.
Greg Jarlewski - James Franco. He would be great as a brother with questionable contacts in the mob and working real-estate on the west-coast. Not to mention being a little bit of a momma's boy with Angelica Houston as Mrs. Jarlewski.
Ethan Jarlewski - who else but Dave Franco would be able to play a better brother to Greg Jarlewski? He would need to be de-handsomed/geeked-up, but Ethan isn't a boring type of guy, and Dave Franco would be able to rock refugee chic.
Breanna "Bree" Jyang - I'm torn between Keiko Agena (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keiko_Agena Lane Kim in the Gilmore Girls) or Emy Coligado (Francis' wife Piama in Malcom in the Middle http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keiko_Agena) Both would be good at portraying a strong geek girl with a raunchy sense of humor and a sort of asian Bettie Page look.
Steve the guy "who turned around Toblerone in 2 years" should be cast with John Krasinski (from the Office). Kind of a sell-out corporate guy, old enough to have a kid he would get an idea like a turtle from, and I could see him becoming smitten with Carol Jarlewski in a little bit of a cougar way.
Casper "Cancer Cowboy" Jesperson- Seth Rogan. He's great at the sarcastic humor and supporting characters, I'm thinking "Freaks and Geeks" Seth, not necessarily stoner Seth. Casper is described of as being a fan of the Duff Beer dude from the Simpsons, someone who values the macho asthetic, but has a sense of humor about it.
I think that Alison Brie would be an amazing Kaitlin. She's really adept at playing the uptight high-achiever with an addictive past. (food in JPod vs drugs in Community). She would also have a lot of great back-and-forth between the other comedy geniuses in this cast.
I definitely was going for an ensemble comedy-centric casting, and I would enjoy seeing these actors interact if by some miracle it was possible to get them together for a project.

Brianna Jyang : Kat Dennings
Bree Jyang is a very strong willed character who exudes of sex appeal and wit. And Kat Dennings is the best actress to play Bree’s character. Dennings has played a lot of funny characters in films and tv series and I think that this character just embodies Denning's character in one of her show. Bree’s character is similar to who Dennings is in her comedy tv series, ‘Two Broke Girls’. Bree loves how she looks, confident with her body, and quick witted. Similarly, these characteristics are exactly what Dennings pulls off in her show and will then bring justice to one of the funniest characters in Jpod. She is a great actress and would not have a hard time channelling her inner Bree Jyang side.
Casper Jesperson: Mark Salling
Mark Salling is famous for his ‘bad boy’ role in the long running tv series, ‘Glee’. And to cast him as Casper Jesperson, aka Cancer Cowboy brings out Cowboy’s cocky character higher up its threshold. Salling is able to play cocky-arrogant and sensible-likable personalities in one character as evidenced in the tv show he is on. For Salling to be able to play this comedic series would be a breeze with his bagged up charm and comedic timing. Thus, he could definitely bring up a sensitive side that Cowboy can sometimes give off when he talks.
Ethan Jarlewski: Jean-Luc Bilodeau
Jean-Luc Bilodeau just brings out that right amount of nerdy look yet still good looking character whenever I watch ‘Baby Daddy’, a comedic tv series he stars on. He is one of the lead actors in this series, and is totally hilarious and can play the gentleman like attitude he shows to the ladies he interacts with in the show. He will play Ethan Jarwelski really well with how he can act or show his care for the people around him similar to his character in the comedy show.
Ultimately, these three actors would be of sufficient budget to cast since they are not top-billed actors, or in demand with films. To put them all in one casting fit since they all have backgrounds and experiences on comedy and with how things work in tv series. Although they are not top- billed, they are amazing at what they do and could express a different side to every character as opposed to how it was originally in the series.
I like your ideas for casting, besides their acting chops, they even look like they might be believable as a tv/movie family.

Cancer Cowboy: Charlie Sheen: He has played (and lived) such a bad boy - funny - womanizer mashup of roles that I believe her would fit perfectly into the role of cancer cowboy, comparative to the actor in the TV show whom doesn't really leave an impression as well as Sheen would (in my opinion) in this role.
Ethans Mom: Sigourney Weaver: Her role in Holes made me immediately want to cast her as Carol Jarlewski for her ability to portray the stoner momma in the show. She can play tough characters and mother-like figures all at the same time. Perfect.
Ethans Dad: Dustin Hoffman: I cast him alongside Sigourney as Ethan's parents because I believe the two would create an interesting dynamic as parents on the show. His ability to be energetic and youthful (even if he isn't) fits the bill for Jim.

I watched the first episode of jPod before casting these actors in these roles. Anyways, here they are:
1) Ethan Jarlewski: David Henrie
I chose David Henrie for the role of Ethan Jarlewski because Ethan was portrayed as the more sensitive one in the TV show, as he was trying to comfort Kaitlin after the others found out about her past and made her feel uncomfortable. He is also shown to be very geeky as well, and I feel that David Henrie would be a very popular choice for Ethan simply because his character portrayal of "Justin Russo" in Wizards of Waverly Place was also very sensitive and seen to be very smart, as well.
2) Kaitlin Joyce: Summer Glau
Kaitlin Joyce is portrayed as the girl-next-door type. She is extremely pretty and looks like she should be very popular, but she isn't at all in jPod and she is also shown to be quite shy. I think Summer Glau would be a perfect fit for Kaitlin because in real life, Summer seems to be quite shy and soft-spoken from interviews I have seen. Also, the characters she has portrayed in the past have often been smart characters who like to keep to themselves, a little bit like an introvert. So, I think Summer is the perfect choice for Kaitlin if a recasting was required.
3) Bree Jyang: Piper Curda
Bree Jyang is shown to be outgoing, likes to hang out with the boys, and isn't afraid to voice her opinions due to her outgoing personality. I think Piper Curda would be an excellent fit for Bree because I have seen her in other shows such as "A.N.T. Farm" and "I Didn't Do It," and she shows an incredible range of acting, able to play characters that are smart and stuck-up to characters (A.N.T. Farm) that are totally dumb and only care about fashion (I Didn't Do It). Bree is shown to be a tomboy who also likes fashion. So, I think playing Bree would be a good challenge for Piper, but I think she could totally pull it off.
4) Carol Jarlewski: Elizabeth Mitchell
From what I have seen in the first episode of jPod, Carol seems to be a very sweet mother who also harbours a dark side after she accidentally kills Tom because of a deal gone bad, and also from keeping this secret from her husband, Jim Jarlewski. Sherry Miller does a fantastic job of portraying Carol, and the other other person that I could do Carol justice is Elizabeth Mitchell. I have seen her in Revolution and Lost, and she is plays "sweet and kind" very well in both series. She is also wonderful at playing a character who harbours dark secrets on the inside, but on the outside, seems very sweet and innocent (cough cough, Juilet in Lost, cough cough). She also looks the part of Carol, as Carol seems to be portrayed as a mother who is a little older, but still very attractive, and gets some of the younger guys' attentions.

Amanda Bynes as Kaitlin Joyce: I chose Amanda as because Kaitlin is a very charming and bubbly girl who is sarcastic but is also goal orientated. Amanda Bynes always play eager and light hearted girls in her movies (Syndey White, What a girl wants) and portrays them in a comedic way, her acting can benefit and bring Kaitlin to life. Amanda typically chooses characters who are sweet but have a bit of fire in them, that's why I think the Amanda can nail the portrayal. Plus, Amanda has been out of work for a while, it would be nice for her to start her career again!
Holland Taylor as Carol: Holland is known for her role on "How I met you mother" as an overbearing mother, she is mischievous and is always up to something. Holland's portrayal would be perfect because she is great at acting out motives has many secrets as she is involved in many activities her sons do not know. Carol is no walk in the park, she's not an average wife who cleans all day, she is also not as innocent as she seems.
Frankie Muniz as Ethan: Frankie Muniz does very impressive portrayals of awkward but intelligent people. His portrayal of Malcom includes trying to stay away from his dysfunctional family in "Malcom in the Middle " .

That's a "funny" way of using em dashes. Yes, you can use them instead of parenthesis, but try not to use them. You can use them to add information by replacing commas. BUT REALLY MAKE SURE IT'S EMPHASIZED—many which misuse it by sometimes conjoining two independent clauses?!?! Just don't go nuts in using it.

First of all: I want an Owen Wilson-Ben Stiller collab. So i’ll cast:
Taylor Swift as: Kaitlin. Swift would be in the show for just boosting ratings. Her popularity would influence the popularity of the show, because who doesn’t know Swift? But I feel she would portray Kaitlin’s personalities well if she acted her self. From what I know, Swift can be flexible in her personalities—many of which can be bossy or sarcastic.
Ben Stiller as Ethan’s mom: I see Ben Stiller in the marijuana business behind the scenes. I also see him as someone who always messes up. For instance, he might kill someone. I don’t care if he’s male, I will hire makeup artist to feminize him. I feel his characteristics can portray Ethan’s mom, as well as a good collab with Wilson
Owen Wilson as Ethan: I just want him to have a one-to-one moment with Stiller. I want him to have a disappointed face when he bails Stiller out of jail. I want him to have a scene in the rain while they both cry. Wilson has a sort of serious, but humorous ambiance around him.
The casting is in order from highest-lowest paid because of the popularity each actor/actress obtains.

item.title: Evaluate Me!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: As a final act of kindness, if you could please fill out this evaluation form before you forget everything you learned in the course, I would appreciate it. All the submissions are completely anonymous; there's absolutely no way to know who you are. The form can be accessed off the class website here: Course Evaluation Link. Or, you can simply fill it out below (make sure you hit the "submit" button!). Thanks for a great semester! Have a great summer!
